title: Is it really so hard to go into Ranked with champs you're experienced with?
body:
Don't queue up for roles with champs you've never touched.

If you want to learn, do it in bots and Normal Draft.

I don't need inexperienced players in my games, god forbid in a carry position I have to Support.

I don't want to get stuck with someone I can't help even with {{champion:25}}

replies.body: It depends what you value the most. Bots and normals are boring for some people. Those people care more about fun than about winning/losing but still want competitive game.

How is draft boring? It's literally just Ranked without borders.

100% the same except one has extra numbers for LP in the end of game lobby.

Yeah, although it would have been nice if the new system just had role preference instead of trying to always match you to your role.  I know people want their roles all the time, but now everyone ONLY knows their one role.  I think people were better players when you had to at least play everything sometimes, instead of trolling once or twice a season when autofilled to support.

That's one of the things I always thought would be nice to actually have on profiles and visible somewhere in game as well.  An icon for every lane, and then those icons would appear either in champ select or on your summoner profile stating your top 3 preferred roles.

Not that the new system isn't nice for getting your role, but it's far from perfect because multiple roles are so over or under utilized.  For example, I like Jungle, Mid, and Support in that order.  If I que jg and mid (I can't que the third role) I get jg essentially every time because mid is so popular.  If I que support and anything I'm going to get support 90% of the time for the same reason.
Just make it so you have to be m5 with 3 chars in each of the 2 spots you 'want'.

>

The mastery system isn't well set up to do this or even a reliable method for it.  Especially for newer players who by nature do NOT have mastery with the champion and aren't likely to get it until they've played a significant number of games.  The mastery system also doesn't actually show mastery, only that you played enough games to get a high score a couple times and enough blue essence for the unlocks.

It slows their progression and gates the game behind a mastery wall.  Whether or not that's worth it is debatable for the limited amount of good it would do.

> [{quoted}](name=Velasan,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=r1J8wOEo,comment-id=0002000000020001,timestamp=2018-04-04T00:55:47.097+0000)

> The mastery system isn't well set up to do this or even a reliable method for it.  Especially for newer players who by nature do NOT have mastery with the champion and aren't likely to get it until they've played a significant number of games. 

How would this negatively affect the quality of the ranked player pool?

The point of M5 is that it doesn't take S's or anything.  Just playing the champ a fair amount.    And as a new player, you probably should play a lot before you look at ranked.  Unless you want to end up in some Bronze 5 hellhole for the next 2 seasons...


About the only thing I'd say is that Mastery ranks should take less overall time to gain the more total mastery ranks you have.  Even if just every 1 mastery point was +1% mastery gain, for people who play a lot of champs it would add up to help boost your getting mastery on a select few champs pretty quick (Just 1 game as every champ is +140% mastery gain.  If you somehow got M7 on everyone currently it would be +980% mastery per game for the next new champ).   Because the more you play the game, the better you get overall, even if the difference is only minor.   Someone who has mastered 40-50 champs can probably pick up another rather quickly, while someone who is already struggling on 5-6 champs would struggle on the 7th one too.

And as a further point, while higher tiers of mastery should only be available if you own the champ, I do think you should be able to at least trigger the start of Mastery 2 on even free week champs.   This gives new players a way to help build up mastery rank early to enable further build up later on, and can be stated as now that you have played the champ, you have a more basic understanding of the champ's kit that you may not get from just seeing them in action (For instance.  You probably might not realize Ekko has to place his W several seconds ahead of time, and just see the circle and subsequent stun really quick), which has increased your overall understanding of the game.
What even was Team Builder?
Teambuilder was basically draft but everybody gets their role chosen.

A mode where you try to climb with the best of your abilities to prove you deserve to be where you are at...

And then I see all the people going "lol winning is not as important as having fun"
